sections.title: The Formula
lecture_lines: Triangle area equals half base times height.
Why half? Watch the rectangle split.
animations: Fade in large white text '½ × b × h' centered on black.
Color-change '½' to flashing yellow, then back to white.
Draw horizontal rectangle; diagonal splits it into two identical right triangles; one triangle flashes.

sections.title: Pick Any Side as Base
lecture_lines: Any side can be the base.
Rotate triangle; base label hops to new side.
Height always meets base at right angle.
animations: Show scalene triangle; three sides glow cyan in turn.
Base label slides smoothly to each glowing side while triangle rotates gently.
Perpendicular dashed line drops from opposite vertex to current base; line flashes magenta.

sections.title: Same Base, Same Height, Same Area
animations: Draw fixed base; triangle vertex slides horizontally leaving faint trail.
Area label '½ b h' remains unchanged while vertex moves; label flashes green once.
Ghosted rectangles formed with each new position appear then fade, all showing equal halves.

sections.title: Quick Examples
animations: Draw triangle; values '6' and '4' slide beside base and height; '12' zooms in center.
Wipe previous; new triangle scales up; values '10' and '5' fade in; '25' pops with bold scale.
Show right triangle; legs self-label '3' and '4'; rotate copy to form rectangle; half flashes revealing '6'.
